description:
T1 – Large Conifer tree – Located in the rear garden on the left hand side.
Reduce the tree by approximately 1 metre, leaving a height of approximately 7 metres. 
Reduce and trim the side branches back by approximately 1-2 metres, to shape and leave a spread of approximately 5 metres.
T2 – Conifer hedge – Located in the rear garden on the right hand side.
Reduce the hedge by approximately 0.5 metre, leaving the hedge approximately 3 metres in height and to match the neighbour’s reduction
T3 - Mimosa - Reduce and reshape by 3m leaving a canopy spread of 8m and height 8m
decision_conditions: The specification is not suitable and therefore needs to be confirmed. The specification needs to be measurable and quantifiable so that we can understand the amount that is to be removed in meters. We need to know the amount to be removed and the remaining crown size. E.g. 2m crown reduction in width and 2m reduction in height, leaving a canopy spread of 3m and height of 5m.
